Is it possible to when pushing files up to HubSpot using the CLI that we can make it overwrite files?
You can use the parameter `--overwrite`
thought that was only for fetch
This also works when uploading.

Has anyone experienced this BUG working with CLI?  The folders inside my HS portal won’t show the files.  Sometimes I have to do multiple refreshes but it’s not consistent.

The files are definitely there. If I do a search the pop right up. It’s just the folder nav is all jacked.

Am I doing something wrong in my local env?

From what I understand only GOOGLE fonts will be supported for the first roll out.

GOOGLE and DEFAULT are the only currently supported options.
Default is for web safe system fonts

I’m getting errors now
No immediate plans for that to change but we do hear ya on wanting to have those kinds of fonts be selectable.
what version of node?
`node -v`
is there a way to do fontface with a link to HS files? that would work
and the command u ran?
I just deployed a fix for this.
id recommend using `npx` rather than `install -g` personally, that removes any ownership issues / install /update issues usually
npm install HubSpot/cms-cli
inside my locally created folder
fyi, the `--overwrite` flag doesn’t impact the `upload` command
are the issues you are seeing specifically with themes?
<@UVCQGSL2C> So you saying to run npx HubSpot/cms-cli ??
ah sry i thought u were trying to run `init`... anything else id use `package.json`
I am but im getting hs command not found
so you are in your local boilerplate directory correct? and you try running what command?
I’m in my local boilerplate trying to run hs init after installing HubSpot/cms-cli into my directory
gotcha, so you need to run `npm run hs ...` or `yarn run hs ...` (based on whichever ur using)
alternatively, you can add to your `package.json` `"scripts"` hash:

```"hs": "hs"```
which will look for the correct binary in ur `node_modules`

so that might be a related issue on Windows machines
